article.headline: Portland 82, Idaho State 73
article.story: POCATELLO, Idaho (AP) -- Pooh Jeter scored 24 points in Portland's 82-73 win over Idaho State Monday night. The Pilots (6-2) started slowly only hitting one of their first twelve shots, but Jeter hit three 3-pointers in a little over a minute to break open the game late in the first half. Idaho State (2-3) trailed 50-30 at the half but refused to give up. The Bengals kept slicing into Portland's lead throughout the second half. Arzelle Lewis hit a three point shot with :57 left cutting the Pilots lead to 75-68. However Portland converted seven free throws to close out the game, with Jeter hitting five of them. Jeff Gardner led Idaho State in scoring with 19 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
